docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Securities and Futures (Open-ended Fund Companies) Rules

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules— (33 of 2021 s. 12)
subsection.def: applicable fee (適用費用), in relation to a matter, means the fee specified in the Securities and Futures (Open-ended Fund Companies) (Fees) Regulation (Cap. 571 sub. leg. AR) to be payable in relation to the matter; (E.R. 4 of 2018)
Court means the Court of First Instance;
financial year (財政年度), in relation to an open-ended fund company, means a financial year of the company determined in accordance with rule 148;
identity card (身分證) means an identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);
OFC code (《開放式基金型公司守則》) means any code or guideline published by the Commission under section 112ZR of the Ordinance;
OFC register (開放式基金型公司登記冊) means the register maintained under rule 24(2);
ordinary resolution (普通決議)—see rule 88;

process agent (法律程序文件代理人), in relation to a non-resident director or non-Hong Kong custodian (principal), means any of the following persons who is authorized to accept service of any process or notice required to be served on the principal—(a)an individual whose usual residential address is in Hong Kong;(b)a company;(c)a firm of solicitors; (L.N. 66 of 2022)(d)a CPA firm as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (L.N. 66 of 2022)
Registrar (處長) means the Registrar of Companies;
special resolution (特別決議)—see rule 89;
specified form (指明格式) means a form specified under rule 21.

subsection.content: In these Rules, in relation to a re-domiciled OFC, a reference to the date of incorporation is a reference to the re-domiciliation date. (33 of 2021 s. 12)
The words and expressions used in these Rules and defined in section 112A or 112ZJA of the Ordinance have the same meaning as in that section. (33 of 2021 s. 12)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Formation of Open-ended Fund Company and Related Matters

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application for registration with Commission before incorporation—section 112D(1) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: An application made under section 112D(1) of the Ordinance in relation to a proposed company must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the proposed company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the name and any other particulars required by the Commission in respect of each person—

subparagraph.content: who is to be a director of the company (if incorporated);
who is to be an investment manager of the company (if incorporated); or
who is to be a custodian of the company (if incorporated); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address of the place which is to be the registered office of the company (if incorporated).

subsection.leadIn: The application must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Requirements for incorporation of open-ended fund company—section 112C of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: If a person proposes to incorporate an open-ended fund company under Part IVA of the Ordinance, the person must, in the manner specified in subrule (2), deliver to the Registrar the following fees and documents, together with the documents specified in section 112C(1) of the Ordinance (prescribed documents)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any) for lodging the prescribed documents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any) for incorporating the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a notice in the form specified by the Commissioner of Inland Revenue under section 5D(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the prescribed business registration fee and levy.

subsection.content: The manner of delivery referred to in subrule (1) is delivery to the Commission.

On registering a proposed company under section 112D(1) of the Ordinance, the Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable, send to the Registrar the documents, fees and levy referred to in subrule (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: levy (徵費) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310);
prescribed business registration fee (訂明的商業登記費) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Content of incorporation form
section.leadIn: The incorporation form mentioned in section 112C(1)(a) of the Ordinance must contain, in relation to the proposed company concerned— (33 of 2021 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for each person who is to be a director (whether or not a non-resident director) of the company after the company’s incorporation—the particulars and statement specified in sections 2 and 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for each person who is to be a non-resident director (principal) of the company after the company’s incorporation, the particulars specified in section 4 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 in relation to each person who is to be a process agent of the principal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the statements specified in section 6 of Part 3 of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the statement of compliance mentioned in rule 7.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Signing of incorporation form
section.content: The incorporation form of a proposed company must be signed by any one of the first directors of the proposed company.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: As to the first directors of an open-ended fund company incorporated under section 112C of the Ordinance—see section 112U(2)(a) of the Ordinance. (33 of 2021 s. 15)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Statement of compliance

subsection.leadIn: The statement of compliance referred to in rule 5(e) is a statement certifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the requirements prescribed by Part IVA of the Ordinance and these Rules in respect of the incorporation of the proposed company concerned have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information, statements and particulars contained in the incorporation form are accurate and consistent with those in the proposed company’s instrument of incorporation.

subsection.content: The Registrar may accept the statement of compliance as sufficient evidence that the requirements for incorporation prescribed by Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules are met with respect to the proposed company.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Formation for a lawful purpose
section.content: An open-ended fund company may only be formed for a lawful purpose.

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Application for registration with Commission before re-domiciliation—section 112ZJB(1) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 112ZJB(1) of the Ordinance (application) must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the non-Hong Kong fund corporation (corporation) at the time of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the place of incorporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the proposed name of the intended OFC;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the name and any other particulars required by the Commission in respect of each person who is to be—

subparagraph.content: a director of the intended OFC;
an investment manager of the intended OFC; or
a custodian of the intended OFC; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the address of the place which is to be the registered office of the intended OFC.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the intended OFC’s instrument of incorporation that—

subparagraph.content: the corporation proposes to adopt; and
has been signed by each person who is to be a director of the intended OFC,

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: if the corporation has one or more non-Hong Kong sub-funds—in relation to the sub-fund or each of the sub-funds—

subparagraph.content: a certified and authenticated copy of the certificate of registration of the sub-fund issued under the law of the corporation’s place of incorporation; or
any other document evidencing the establishment of the sub-fund under the law of that place acceptable to the Commission;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a certified and authenticated copy of the instrument of incorporation or equivalent constitutive document of the corporation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate issued in compliance with the requirement in subrule (4) to the effect that as at the date of the certificate—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: has only 1 place of incorporation, being the one referred to in subrule (1)(b);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has a registration relating to its incorporation or domicile under the law of its place of incorporation; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: does not have such a registration under the law of any other jurisdiction;
no order has been notified to the corporation, and no resolution has been passed, to wind up or liquidate the corporation in any place;

no appointment of a receiver, liquidator or person acting in a similar capacity has been notified to the corporation, and no person is acting as such a receiver, liquidator or person in any place with respect to the corporation or any part of its property;

the corporation is not operating or carrying on business under any scheme, order, compromise or other similar arrangement relating to the insolvency of the corporation entered into or made by the corporation with any person in any place;

any consent to or approval for the intended deregistration of the corporation in its place of incorporation required by any contract entered into or undertaking given by the corporation has been obtained or waived; and

the intended deregistration of the corporation in its place of incorporation is not prohibited under the law of that place or by the instrument of incorporation or equivalent constitutive document of the corporation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate issued in compliance with the requirement in subrule (4) to the effect that—

subparagraph.content: the board of directors of the corporation has made a full inquiry into the affairs of the corporation; and
it has formed an opinion that the corporation will be able to pay its debts in full within 12 months beginning on the date of the application,

paragraph.continued: together with a statement of assets and liabilities (including contingent liabilities) of the corporation as at the latest practicable date, which must be within 3 months before the date of the certificate; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any).

subsection.content: If the corporation has one or more non-Hong Kong sub-funds, a reference to the corporation in subrule (2)(e)(iii), (iv), (v) or (vi) or (f) includes the sub-fund or each of the sub-funds.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subrule (2)(e) or (f), the requirement is that the certificate is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued by the board of directors of the corporation within 5 weeks before the date of the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signed by a director of the corporation, and certified by the director as having been approved by resolution of the board of directors of the corporation.

subsection.content: If any document mentioned in subrule (2) is not in English or Chinese, the document must be accompanied by a certified translation of the document in English.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: authenticated (認證) means authenticated in the manner specified by the Commission;
certified (核證) means certified in the manner specified by the Commission;

non-Hong Kong sub-fund (非香港子基金), in relation to a non-Hong Kong fund corporation the instrument of incorporation (or equivalent constitutive document) of which provides for the division of its relevant property into separate parts, means each such separate part;
relevant property (有關財產), in relation to a non-Hong Kong fund corporation, means the property under the collective investment scheme that is constituted as the corporation.

section.name: s8B
section.heading: Application for certificate of re-domiciliation—section 112ZJC of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: A non-Hong Kong fund corporation that applies for a certificate of re-domiciliation under section 112ZJC of the Ordinance must deliver, in the manner specified in subrule (2), to the Registrar the following fees and documents, together with the documents specified in section 112ZJC(1) of the Ordinance (prescribed documents)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any) for lodging the prescribed documents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any) for issuing a certificate of re-domiciliation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a notice in the form specified by the Commissioner of Inland Revenue under section 5D(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the prescribed business registration fee and levy.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subrule (1), delivery to the Registrar is to be done by way of delivery to the Commission.

On registering a non-Hong Kong fund corporation under section 112ZJB(1) of the Ordinance, the Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable, send to the Registrar the documents, fees and levy referred to in subrule (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: prescribed business registration fee (訂明的商業登記費) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310).

section.name: s8C
section.heading: Content of re-domiciliation form
section.leadIn: The re-domiciliation form mentioned in section 112ZJC(1)(a) of the Ordinance must contain, in relation to the intended OFC—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars specified in section 1 of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: the statements specified in section 6 of Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the statement of compliance mentioned in rule 8E.

section.name: s8D
section.heading: Signing of re-domiciliation form
section.content: The re-domiciliation form of a non-Hong Kong fund corporation must be signed by any one of the first directors of the intended OFC.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: As to the first directors of a re-domiciled OFC—see section 112U(2)(b) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s8E
section.heading: Statement of compliance

subsection.leadIn: The statement of compliance referred to in rule 8C(e) is a statement certifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the requirements prescribed by Part IVA of the Ordinance and these Rules for the non-Hong Kong fund corporation to become a re-domiciled OFC (except for section 112ZJE of the Ordinance) (relevant requirements) have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information, statements and particulars contained in the re-domiciliation form are accurate and consistent with those in the intended OFC’s instrument of incorporation.

subsection.content: The Registrar may accept the statement of compliance as sufficient evidence that the relevant requirements are met.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Change of Name of Open-ended Fund Company

section.name: s9
section.heading: Change of name of open-ended fund company

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must not change its name unless the Commission has approved the change under subrule (2).
On an application made in writing and on payment of the applicable fee (if any) by an open-ended fund company, the Commission may grant approval to the company for a change of its name.
The Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable after granting an approval under subrule (2), give the company notice in writing of the approval.

subsection.leadIn: The open-ended fund company must, within 15 days after the date on which the company is given notice of the Commission’s approval under subrule (3), deliver in the manner specified in subrule (5) to the Registrar for registration a notice, in the specified form, of the change of name of the company and the following fees—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any) for lodging the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicable fee (if any) for issuing a certificate of change of name under subrule (7)(c).

subsection.content: The manner of delivery referred to in subrule (4) is delivery to the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable after granting the approval under subrule (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the Registrar of the approval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the notice and the fees to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: After receiving the notice of approval of the Commission under subrule (6)(a) and the notice and the fees under subrule (6)(b), the Registrar must take the following actions if the Registrar is satisfied that the requirements for the change of name as prescribed by Part IVA of the Ordinance and these Rules are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the notice referred to in subrule (6)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter the new name of the company in the OFC register in place of the former name; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue to the company a certificate of change of name.

subsection.content: The change of name of the company has effect from the date on which the certificate of change of name is issued under subrule (7)(c) in respect of the company.

A change of name of the company under this rule does not affect any rights or obligations of the company or render defective any legal proceedings by or against the company. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by or against the company by its former name may be commenced or continued by or against it by its new name.

If an open-ended fund company contravenes subrule (4), the company commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Capacity and Powers of Open-ended Fund Company

section.name: s10
section.heading: Open-ended fund company’s exercise of powers limited by instrument of incorporation

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must not do any act that it is not authorized to do by its instrument of incorporation.
If a power of an open-ended fund company is expressly modified or excluded by its instrument of incorporation, the company must not exercise the power contrary to that modification or exclusion.
A shareholder of an open-ended fund company may commence proceedings to restrain the company from doing an act, or exercising a power, in contravention of subrule (1) or (2).

Proceedings must not be commenced under subrule (3) in respect of an act to be done, or a power to be exercised, in fulfillment of a legal obligation arising from a previous act of an open-ended fund company.
An act done, or a power exercised, by an open-ended fund company is not invalid only because the company does the act or exercises the power in contravention of subrule (1) or (2).

section.name: s11
section.heading: Transaction or act binds open-ended fund company despite limitation in instrument of incorporation etc.

subsection.content: In favour of a person dealing with an open-ended fund company in good faith, the power of the company’s directors to bind the company, or authorize others to do so, is to be regarded as free of any limitation under any relevant document of the company.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subrule (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person deals with an open-ended fund company if the person is a party to a transaction or any other act to which the company is a party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person dealing with an open-ended fund company—

subparagraph.content: is presumed, unless there is evidence to the contrary, to have acted in good faith;
is not to be regarded as acting in bad faith because of the person’s knowing that an act is beyond a director’s powers under any relevant document of the company; and
is not required to inquire as to the limitations on the power of the company’s directors to bind the company or authorize others to do so.

subsection.content: This rule does not affect the right of any shareholder of an open-ended fund company to commence proceedings to restrain the company from doing an act that is beyond the directors’ powers.
Proceedings must not be commenced under subrule (3) in respect of an act to be done in fulfilment of a legal obligation arising from a previous act of the company.
This rule does not affect any liability incurred by the directors, or any other person, by reason of the directors exceeding their powers.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: relevant document (有關文件), in relation to an open-ended fund company, means—(a)the company’s instrument of incorporation;(b)any resolution of the company or of any class of shareholders of the company; or(c)any agreement between the shareholders, or shareholders of any class of shareholders, of the company.

section.name: s12
section.heading: No constructive notice of matters disclosed in instrument of incorporation etc.
section.leadIn: A person is not regarded as having notice of any matter only because the matter is disclosed in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company kept by the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a return or resolution kept by the Registrar.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Instrument of incorporation

subsection.leadIn: The instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the English or Chinese language; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be signed by each of the first directors of the company.

subsection.content: The instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company must include a statement that the object of the company is the operation of the company as a collective investment scheme.

The instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company is binding on the company’s officers, its custodian, and its shareholders, and all these persons are taken to have notice of the provisions of the instrument of incorporation.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Alteration of instrument of incorporation

subsection.content: Subject to the Ordinance, these Rules and its instrument of incorporation, an open-ended fund company may alter its instrument of incorporation.

subsection.leadIn: An open-ended fund company must not alter any of the following statements contained in its instrument of incorporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement referred to in section 112K(2)(b), (e), (f), (g) or (h) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company is an open-ended fund company with sub-funds, the statement referred to in section 112K(3) of the Ordinance; (33 of 2021 s. 17)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the statement referred to in rule 13(2).

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must give notice in writing to the Commission of each alteration made by the company to the company’s instrument of incorporation.
Any alteration made in contravention of subrule (2) has no effect.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Notifying Registrar on alteration of instrument of incorporation

subsection.leadIn: If an open-ended fund company alters its instrument of incorporation under rule 14, the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the alteration takes effect, deliver to the Registrar for registration, the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of the alteration in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the company’s instrument of incorporation as altered, which is certified by a director of the company as correct copy of the instrument.

subsection.content: Subrule (1) does not apply to an alteration to change the name of an open-ended fund company under rule 9.

subsection.leadIn: If a provision of, or the effect of a provision of, the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company is altered by an order of the Court, the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the alteration takes effect, deliver to the Registrar for registration, the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of the alteration in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an office copy of the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the company’s instrument of incorporation as altered by the order.

subsection.content: Subrule 3(b) does not apply if the company is required to deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar under another provision of the Ordinance.

If an open-ended fund company contravenes subrule (1) or (3), the company commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Name and particulars to appear in correspondence etc.

subsection.leadIn: An open-ended fund company must disclose the details specified in subrule (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in every letter of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in each agreement entered into by the company with another person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in every other document issued by the company in the course of its business; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on any website of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The details referred to in subrule (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the open-ended fund company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact of the company’s registration with the Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number with which it is so registered;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the address of the registered office of the company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the fact that it is an open-ended fund company with variable capital and limited liability; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in the case of a company with sub-funds, the fact that it is an open-ended fund company with segregated liability between sub-funds.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Execution of documents

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company may execute a document under its common seal.
An open-ended fund company may also execute a document by having it signed by at least one director on the company’s behalf.
A document signed in accordance with subrule (2) and expressed (in whatever words) to be executed by the company has effect as if the document had been executed under the company’s common seal.
This rule has effect subject to section 112M of the Ordinance.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Execution of deeds

subsection.leadIn: An open-ended fund company may execute a document as a deed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: executing it in accordance with rule 17;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having it expressed (in whatever words) to be executed by the company as a deed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: delivering it as a deed.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subrule (1)(c), if a document is executed in accordance with rule 17, the document is presumed, unless there is evidence to the contrary, to be delivered as a deed.

An open-ended fund company may, either generally or in respect of any specific matter, by an instrument executed as a deed, empower any person as its attorney to execute a deed or any other document on its behalf in Hong Kong or elsewhere.
A deed or any other document executed by an attorney on behalf of the company binds the company and has effect as if it were executed by the company.
This rule does not affect the operation of any other Ordinance as to the execution of powers of attorney.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Registered office
section.content: The address stated in the incorporation form registered under section 112C(3) of the Ordinance or the re-domiciliation form registered under section 112ZJC(3) of the Ordinance in respect of an open-ended fund company is to be regarded as the address of the registered office of the company, until a notice of change of the address is delivered to the Registrar under rule 20.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Change of address of registered office

subsection.content: If the address of an open-ended fund company’s registered office is changed, the company must, within 15 days after the change, deliver to the Registrar for registration, a notice of the change in the specified form.

If an open-ended fund company contravenes subrule (1), the company commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Registrar may specify form

subsection.content: The Registrar may specify the form of any document, required under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules, to be delivered to the Registrar.
Subrule (1) does not apply to a document the form of which is prescribed by Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules.
In specifying the form of a document under subrule (1), the Registrar may specify more than one form of the document, whether as alternatives or to provide for different circumstances.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Registrar may issue guidelines

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may issue guidelines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating the manner in which the Registrar proposes to perform any function under any provision of Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidance on the operation of any provision of Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules to the extent that it relates to the performance of any function by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must publish the guidelines in a manner appropriate to bring them to the notice of persons affected by them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make copies of the guidelines available to the public (in hard copy form or electronic form).

subsection.content: Guidelines issued under this rule are not subsidiary legislation.
The Registrar may amend or revoke any of the guidelines. Subrules (2) and (3) apply to an amendment or revocation of guidelines in the same way as they apply to the issuance of guidelines.
A person does not incur any civil or criminal liability only because the person has contravened any of the guidelines.

subsection.leadIn: If, in any legal proceedings, the court is satisfied that a guideline is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guideline is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene the guideline may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate the matter.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Registrar may authenticate document etc.

subsection.content: If a document is required under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules to be signed by the Registrar or to bear the Registrar’s printed signature, the Registrar may authenticate it in any manner that the Registrar thinks fit.
If anything is authorized to be certified by the Registrar under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules, the Registrar may certify it in a manner that the Registrar thinks fit.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Registrar must keep records and maintain register of open-ended fund companies

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must keep records of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information contained in every document that is delivered to the Registrar for registration and that the Registrar decides to register under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information contained in every certificate that is issued by the Registrar under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules.

subsection.content: The Registrar must maintain a register of open-ended fund companies.

subsection.leadIn: The register maintained under subrule (2) must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the records kept under subrule (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notes made by the Registrar under rule 40; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the index of directors kept by the Registrar under rule 109(1).

section.name: s25
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to rule 24

subsection.content: The records kept under rule 24(1) must be such that information relating to an open-ended fund company is associated with the company in a manner determined by the Registrar, so as to enable all the information relating to the company to be retrieved.
Each of the records mentioned in subrule (1) must be kept in a form that enables any person to inspect the information contained in the record and to make a copy of the information.
Subject to subrules (1) and (2), a record of information kept for the purposes of rule 24(1) may be kept in any form that the Registrar thinks fit.
Notes made by the Registrar under rule 40 and the index of directors kept by the Registrar under rule 109(1) may be made or kept in any form that the Registrar thinks fit.

If the Registrar keeps the record mentioned in subrule (3) in a form that differs from the form in which the document or certificate containing the information was delivered to, or generated by, the Registrar, the record is presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to represent the information contained in the document or certificate as delivered or generated.

If the Registrar records the information contained in a document for the purposes of rule 24(1), the Registrar is to be regarded as having discharged any duty imposed by Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules on the Registrar to keep, file or register the document or certificate concerned.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Registrar not required to keep certain documents etc.

subsection.content: The Registrar may destroy or dispose of a document delivered to the Registrar for registration under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules if the information contained in the document has been recorded by the Registrar in any other form for the purposes of rule 24(1).
If a document or certificate has been kept by the Registrar for at least 7 years for the purposes of rule 24(1), the Registrar may destroy or dispose of the document or certificate.

If the Registrar is required by rule 43 not to make any information available for public inspection, the Registrar is not required to keep a record of the information for any longer than appears to the Registrar to be reasonably necessary for the purpose for which the information was delivered to the Registrar.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Registrar must keep index of names of open-ended fund company
section.content: The Registrar must keep an index of the names of every open-ended fund company.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Unsatisfactory document

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, a document delivered to the Registrar for registration is unsatisfactory if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information contained in the document is not capable of being reproduced in legible form;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the document is neither in English nor in Chinese and is not accompanied by a translation of it in English that is certified in the manner specified by the Commission; (33 of 2021 s. 19)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements specified in relation to the document under rule 29 are not complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the document is not delivered in accordance with an agreement made under rule 30 in relation to it;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicable requirements of Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules under which the document is delivered are not complied with;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the document is not accompanied by the fee payable for the registration;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the document, or any signature on, or any digital or electronic signature accompanying, the document—

subparagraph.content: is incomplete or incorrect; or
is altered without proper authority;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the information contained in the document—

subparagraph.content: is internally inconsistent; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the information contained in the document derives from anything that—

subparagraph.content: is invalid or ineffective; or
has been done without the open-ended fund company’s authority; or

paragraph.content: the document contains matters contrary to law.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: applicable requirements (適用規定), in relation to a document, means the requirements as regards—(a)the contents of the document;(b)the form of the document;(c)the authentication of the document; and(d)the manner of delivery of the document.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Registrar may specify requirements for rule 28(1)(b)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, in relation to any document required or authorized to be delivered to the Registrar under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify requirements for the purpose of enabling the Registrar to make copies or image records of the document and to keep records of the information contained in it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the authentication of the document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the manner of delivery of the document.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, in relation to any document authorized to be delivered to the Registrar for registration under rule 37(3) for the purpose of rectification of an error, specify requirements as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the delivery of the document in a form and manner enabling it to be associated with the document containing the error; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the identification of the document containing the error.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subrules (1) and (2), the Registrar may specify different requirements for different documents or classes of documents, or for different circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subrule (1)(b), the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the document to be authenticated by a particular person or a person of a particular description;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the means of authentication; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the document to contain, or to be accompanied by, the name or registration number, or both, of the company to which it relates.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subrule (1)(c), the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the document to be in hard copy form, electronic form or any other form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the document to be delivered by post or any other means;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify requirements as to the address to which the document is to be delivered; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a document to be delivered by electronic means, specify requirements as to the hardware and software to be used and the technical specifications.

subsection.content: This rule does not empower the Registrar to require a document to be delivered to the Registrar by electronic means.
Requirements specified under this rule are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Registrar may agree to delivery by electronic means (for rule 28(1)(c))

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may enter into an agreement with an open-ended fund company to provide that any document, or any class of document, that relates to the company, and is required or authorized to be delivered to the Registrar under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: will be delivered by electronic means, except as provided for in the agreement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: will conform to the requirements—

subparagraph.content: specified in the agreement; or
specified by the Registrar in accordance with the agreement.

subsection.content: An agreement with an open-ended fund company may also provide that any document, or any class of document, that relates to the company, and is required or authorized to be delivered by the Registrar to it under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules, will be delivered by electronic means.
The Registrar may specify a standard form for an agreement and the extent to which the form is to be used.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Registrar may refuse to accept or register document

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar is of the opinion that a document delivered for registration under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules is unsatisfactory, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may refuse to accept the document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, after having accepted the document, exercise the powers specified in subrule (2) or (3).

subsection.content: The Registrar may refuse to register the document and return the document to the person who delivered it for registration.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may also advise that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the document be appropriately amended or completed, and redelivered for registration with or without a supplementary document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fresh document be delivered for registration in its place.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuses to accept a document under subrule (1)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not received a document; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuses to register a document under subrule (2),

subsection.continued: the document is to be regarded as not having been delivered to the Registrar in satisfaction of the provision of Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules that requires or authorizes the document to be delivered to the Registrar.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Registrar may withhold registration of document pending further particulars etc.
section.leadIn: For the purpose of determining whether the powers specified in rule 31(2) and (3) are exercisable in relation to a document, the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withhold the registration of the document pending compliance with the request under paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: request the person who is required or authorized to deliver the document to the Registrar for registration under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules to do any or all of the following within a period specified by the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: to produce any other document, information or evidence that, in the Registrar’s opinion, is necessary for the Registrar to determine the question as to whether the document is unsatisfactory;
to appropriately amend or complete the document, and redeliver it for registration with or without a supplementary document;
to apply to the court for any order or direction that the Registrar thinks necessary and to conduct the application diligently;
to comply with other directions of the Registrar.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Appeal against Registrar’s decision to refuse registration

subsection.content: If a person is aggrieved by a decision of the Registrar to refuse to register a document under rule 31(2), the person may, within 42 days after the decision, appeal to the Court against the decision.
The Court may make any order that it thinks fit, including an order as to costs.
If the Court makes an order as to costs against the Registrar under subrule (2), the costs are payable out of the general revenue, and the Registrar is not personally liable for the costs.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Certain period to be disregarded for calculating daily penalty for failure to deliver document to Registrar

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document is delivered to the Registrar for registration under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar refuses to register the document under rule 31(2).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must send a notice of the refusal, and the reasons for the refusal, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who is required to deliver the document to the Registrar for registration under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules or, if there is more than one person who is so required, any of those persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if another person delivers, on behalf of the person so required, the document to the Registrar for registration, that other person.

subsection.content: If a notice is sent to a person under subrule (2) with respect to a document, the period specified in subrule (4) is to be disregarded for the purpose of calculating the daily penalty under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules that makes it an offence for failing to comply with a requirement to deliver the document and that imposes a penalty for each day during which the offence continues.
The period is one beginning on the date on which the document was delivered to the Registrar and ending with the 14th day after the date on which the notice is sent under subrule (2).

division.name: D4
division.heading: Registrar’s Powers in Relation to Keeping OFC Register

section.name: s35
section.heading: Registrar may require open-ended fund company to resolve inconsistency with OFC register

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Registrar that the information contained in a document registered by the Registrar in respect of an open-ended fund company is inconsistent with other information relating to the company on the OFC register, the Registrar may give notice to the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating in what respect the information contained in the document appears to be inconsistent with other information on the OFC register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring the company to take steps to resolve the inconsistency.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subrule (1)(b), the Registrar may require the company to deliver to the Registrar within the period specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information required to resolve the inconsistency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence that proceedings have been commenced by the company in the Court for the purpose of resolving the inconsistency and that the proceedings are being conducted diligently.

subsection.content: If an open-ended fund company fails to comply with a requirement under subrule (1)(b), the company commits an offence, and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

If an open-ended fund company is charged with an offence under subrule (3) for failure to comply with a requirement, it is a defence to establish that the company took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with the requirement.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Registrar may require further information for updating etc.

subsection.content: For the purpose of ensuring that a person’s information on the OFC register is accurate or bringing the information up to date, the Registrar may send a notice to the person requiring the person to give the Registrar, within a period specified by the Registrar, any information about the person, being information of the kind that is included on the OFC register.

If a person fails to comply with the requirement under subrule (1), the person commits an offence, and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a person is charged with an offence under subrule (2) for failure to comply with a requirement, it is a defence to establish that the person took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with the requirement.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Registrar may rectify typographical or clerical error in OFC register

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on the Registrar’s own initiative, rectify a typographical or clerical error contained in any information on the OFC register.
The Registrar may, on application by an open-ended fund company, rectify a typographical or clerical error contained in any information relating to the company on the OFC register.

If, in relation to an application for the purposes of subrule (2), a document showing the rectification is delivered to the Registrar for registration, the Registrar may rectify the error by registering the document.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Registrar must rectify information on OFC register on order of Court

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application by any person, by order direct the Registrar to rectify any information on the OFC register or to remove any information from it if the Court is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the information derives from anything that—

subparagraph.content: is invalid or ineffective; or
has been done without the open-ended fund company’s authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the information—

subparagraph.content: is factually inaccurate; or
derives from anything that is factually inaccurate or forged.

subsection.content: If, in relation to an application for the purposes of subrule (1), a document showing the rectification is filed with the Court, the Court may require the Registrar to rectify the information by registering the document.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not order the removal of any information from the OFC register under subrule (1) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: even if a document showing the rectification in question is registered, the continuing presence of the information on the OFC register will cause material damage to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s interest in removing the information outweighs the interest of other persons in the information continuing to appear on the OFC register.

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order for the rectification of any information on or the removal of any information from the OFC register under subrule (1), the Court may make any consequential order that appears to it to be just with respect to the legal effect (if any) to be accorded to the information by virtue of its having appeared on the OFC register.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court makes an order for the removal of any information from the OFC register under subrule (1), the Court may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a note made under rule 40(1) in relation to the information is to be removed from the OFC register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the order is not to be made available for public inspection as part of the OFC register; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: no note is to be made under rule 40(1) as a result of the order; or
any such note is to be restricted to providing information in relation to the matters specified by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not give a direction under subrule (5) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following may cause damage to the company—

subparagraph.content: the presence on the OFC register of the note or an unrestricted note;
the availability for public inspection of the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s interest in non-disclosure outweighs the interest of other persons in disclosure.

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under this rule, the person who made the application must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Registrar may appear in proceedings for rectification

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings before the Court for the purposes of rule 38, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is entitled to appear or be represented, and be heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must appear if so directed by the Court.

subsection.content: Whether or not the Registrar appears in those proceedings, the Registrar may submit to the Court a written statement signed by the Registrar, giving particulars of the matters relevant to the proceedings and within the Registrar’s knowledge.
Unless otherwise directed by the Court, a statement submitted under subrule (2) is to be regarded as forming part of the evidence in the proceedings.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Registrar may annotate OFC register

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may make a note in the OFC register for the purpose of providing information in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a rectification of an error contained in any information on the OFC register under rule 37;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rectification of any information on the OFC register under rule 38;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a removal of any information from the OFC register under rule 38; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information on the OFC register.

subsection.content: For the purposes of Part IVA of the Ordinance and these Rules, a note made under subrule (1) is part of the OFC register.
The Registrar may remove a note if the Registrar is satisfied that it no longer serves any useful purpose.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Registrar must make OFC register available for public inspection

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must make the OFC register available for public inspection at all reasonable times so as to enable any member of the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain whether the member of the public is dealing with—

subparagraph.content: an open-ended fund company or its directors, in matters of or connected with any act of the company;
a director of an open-ended fund company, in matters of or connected with the administration of the company, or of its property;
a person who has entered into possession of the property of an open-ended fund company as mortgagee;
a person who is appointed as liquidator in the winding up of an open-ended fund company under Part 11; or
a person who is appointed as the receiver or manager of the property of an open-ended fund company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to ascertain the particulars of the company, its directors, or its former directors (if any), or the particulars of any person mentioned in paragraph (a)(iii), (iv) or (v).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subrule (1), the Registrar must, on receiving the applicable fee, allow a person to inspect any information on the OFC register in any form that the Registrar thinks fit.

For the purposes of subrule (1), the Registrar may, on receiving the applicable fee, produce to a person a copy or a certified true copy of any document or information on the OFC register, in so far as the document or information may be made available for public inspection, in any form that the Registrar thinks fit.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See section 45 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for inspection of records of disqualification orders made under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (Cap. 32) and liquidators appointed in the winding up of an open-ended fund company under Part X of Cap. 32.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Registrar’s certified true copy admissible as evidence
section.leadIn: In any proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of any information produced under rule 41(3), and purporting to be certified by the Registrar as a true copy of the information, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document is proof of the information in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Information excluded from public inspection by law or court order
section.content: The Registrar must not make available for public inspection under rule 41 any information excluded from public inspection by or under an Ordinance or by an order of the court.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Registrar may issue certificates in any manner

subsection.content: The Registrar may issue a certificate under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules in any manner the Registrar thinks fit.
Without limiting the powers of the Registrar under subrule (1), the Registrar may issue a certificate in the form of an electronic record.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules, a protected person provides a service by means of which information in electronic form is supplied to the public, or supplies information by means of magnetic tapes or any electronic mode, the protected person is not personally liable for any loss or damage suffered by a user of the service or information by reason of an error or omission appearing in the information if the error or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made in good faith and in the ordinary course of the discharge of the protected person’s duties; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has occurred or arisen as a result of any defect or breakdown in the service or in any equipment used for the service or for supplying the information.

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules, a protected person provides a service or facility by means of which documents may be delivered to the Registrar by electronic means, the protected person is not personally liable for any loss or damage suffered by a user of the service or facility by reason of an error or omission appearing in a document delivered to the Registrar by means of the service or facility if the error or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made in good faith and in the ordinary course of the discharge of the protected person’s duties; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has occurred or arisen as a result of any defect or breakdown in the service or facility or in any equipment used for the service or facility.

subsection.content: The protection given to a protected person by subrules (1) and (2) in respect of an error or omission does not affect any liability of the Government in tort for the error or omission.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: protected person (受保障人) means a person authorized by the Registrar to supply the information or provide the service or facility.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Registrar may require production of records and documents etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of enquiring into whether any specified act has been done, if each of the conditions specified in subrule (2) is satisfied, the Registrar may, by notice in writing, require a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to produce, within the time and at the place specified in the notice, any record or document specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the record or document is produced, to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (3), the conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the Registrar has reason to believe that—

subparagraph.content: a specified act has been done;
the record, document, information or explanation is relevant to the enquiry; and
the person is in possession of the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is so certified in writing by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2)(a)(iii) does not apply if the person who is to be required to produce the record or document is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body corporate to which the act relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer of the body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not require an authorized financial institution to produce any record or document, or disclose any information, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution under subrule (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar has reasonable grounds to believe that the customer may be able to provide information relevant to the enquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the production or disclosure is necessary for the purposes of the enquiry and so certifies in writing.

subsection.content: If an authorized financial institution produces a record or document relating to the affairs of its customer in compliance with a requirement imposed under subrule (1), the Registrar may also require that customer to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.
If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subrule (1), the Registrar may make copies, or otherwise record the details, of the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: specified act (指明作為) means the making of a statement in any document provided to the Registrar under Part IVA of the Ordinance or these Rules that would constitute an offence under rule 195(1).

section.name: s47
section.heading: Registrar may delegate powers under rule 46
section.content: The Registrar may delegate in writing any or all of the powers conferred under rule 46 to any public officer.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Offences for failing to comply with requirements under rule 46 etc.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under rule 46.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under rule 46.

An officer or employee of a body corporate on which a requirement is imposed under rule 46 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the body corporate to fail to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under rule 46—

subparagraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or
provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the record or document, or the information or explanation, is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under rule 46—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: An officer or employee of a body corporate on which a requirement is imposed under rule 46 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the body corporate to, in purported compliance with the requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person under rule 46 only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subrule (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subrule (2), (3), (5) or (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subrule (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar requires a person, under rule 46, to provide any information or explanation in respect of any record or document produced, the Registrar or delegate must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subrule (2) on the admissibility in evidence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar’s or delegate’s requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information or explanation provided by the person.

subsection.leadIn: If the conditions specified in subrule (3) are satisfied, the Registrar’s or delegate’s requirement, as well as the information or explanation provided by the person, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings other than those in which the person is charged with an offence in respect of the information or explanation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under rule 48(4), (5) or (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for perjury.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the information or explanation might tend to incriminate the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person so claims before providing the information or explanation.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Protection in relation to certain disclosures

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person makes a disclosure to the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar otherwise than in compliance with a requirement made by the Registrar or delegate under rule 46; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure satisfies each of the conditions specified in subrule (2),

subsection.continued: the person is not liable in any proceedings relating to a breach of duty of confidentiality by reason only of the disclosure.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the disclosure is of a kind that the person could be required to make under rule 46;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person makes the disclosure in good faith and in the reasonable belief that the disclosure is capable of assisting the Registrar or delegate in the enquiry under rule 46;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the information disclosed is not more than is reasonably necessary for the purpose of assisting the Registrar or delegate in the enquiry under rule 46; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the disclosure is not prohibited by virtue of any enactment.

subsection.content: Subrule (1) does not apply to a disclosure made by a person in the capacity as a banker or lawyer in respect of information to which the person owes a duty of confidentiality in that capacity.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Protection of informers etc.

subsection.content: Any information concerning the identity of a protected person is not admissible in evidence in any proceedings before a court or tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: In those proceedings, a witness is not obliged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to disclose the name or address of a protected person who is not a witness in those proceedings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to state any matter that would lead, or would tend to lead, to discovery of the name or address of a protected person who is not a witness in those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a book, document or paper that is in evidence, or liable to inspection, in those proceedings contains an entry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in which a protected person is named or described; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that might lead to discovery of a protected person,

subsection.continued: the court or tribunal must cause the entry to be concealed from view, or to be obliterated, so far as may be necessary to protect the identity of the protected person from discovery.

subsection.leadIn: In those proceedings, the court or tribunal may, despite subrule (1), (2) or (3), permit inquiry, and require full disclosure, concerning a protected person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is of the opinion that justice cannot be fully done between the parties to the proceedings without disclosure of the name of the protected person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that the protected person made a material statement that the person—

subparagraph.content: knew or believed to be false; or
did not believe to be true.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: protected person (受保障人士) means—(a)an informer who has given information to the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar with respect to an enquiry under rule 46; or(b)a person who has assisted the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar with respect to such an enquiry.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Production of information in information systems etc.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar requires any record or document to be produced under rule 46; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or matter contained in the record or document is recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form,

subsection.continued: the Registrar or delegate may require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter, or the relevant part of the recording, in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar requires any record or document to be produced under rule 46; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or matter contained in the record or document is recorded in an information system,

subsection.continued: the Registrar or delegate may require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter, or the relevant part of the recording, in a form that enables the information or matter to be reproduced in a legible form.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Lien claimed on records or documents
section.leadIn: If a person claims a lien on any record or document in the person’s possession that is required to be produced under rule 46—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lien does not affect the requirement to produce the record or document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no fee is payable for or in respect of the production; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the production does not affect the lien.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Offence for destruction of documents etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person destroys, falsifies, conceals or otherwise disposes of, or causes or permits the destruction, falsification, concealment or disposal of, any record or document that is required to be produced under rule 46; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person does so with intent to conceal, from the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar by whom the requirement was imposed, facts or matters capable of being disclosed by the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subrule (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Inspection of records or documents seized etc.

subsection.content: This rule applies if the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar has taken possession of any record or document under rule 46.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar or delegate must, subject to any reasonable conditions the Registrar or delegate may impose as to security or otherwise, permit a person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document had the Registrar or delegate not taken possession of it, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to inspect it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of it.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Shares

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company may issue more than one class of shares.
The scheme property of an open-ended fund company belongs exclusively to the company and no shareholder of the company has any interest in the scheme property of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The rights that attach to each share of any given class are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right, in accordance with the company’s instrument of incorporation, to participate in or receive profits, income or other returns arising from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of the scheme property or any part of the scheme property, or sums represented to be paid or to be likely to be paid out of these profits, income or other returns;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the right, if provided in, and in accordance with, the company’s instrument of incorporation, to vote at any general meeting of the company or at any relevant class meeting; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other rights as may be provided for, in relation to shares of that class, in the company’s instrument of incorporation.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Varying class rights
section.content: Rights attached to shares in a class of shares in an open-ended fund company may be varied only in accordance with provisions in the company’s instrument of incorporation for the variation of those rights.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Nature and transferability of shares

subsection.content: A share or other interest of a shareholder of an open-ended fund company is personal property.
A share or other interest of a shareholder of an open-ended fund company is transferable in accordance with the company’s instrument of incorporation.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Provision for different amounts to be paid on shares
section.leadIn: If authorized by its instrument of incorporation to do so, an open-ended fund company may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make arrangements on the issue of shares for a difference between the shareholders in the amounts and times of payment of calls on their shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accept from any shareholder the whole or part of the amount remaining unpaid on any shares held by the shareholder, although no part of that amount has been called up; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: pay a dividend in proportion to the amount paid up on each share where a larger amount is paid up on some shares than on others.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Requirement for instrument of transfer

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must not register a transfer of shares in the company unless a proper instrument of transfer has been delivered to the company.
Subrule (1) does not affect any power of an open-ended fund company to register as a shareholder a person to whom the right to shares has been transmitted by operation of law.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Registration of transfers

subsection.content: The transferee or transferor of shares in an open-ended fund company may lodge the instrument of transfer with the company.

subsection.leadIn: The company must, within 2 months after the instrument of transfer is lodged, either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the transferee and the transferor notice of refusal to register the transfer.

subsection.content: If an open-ended fund company refuses to register the transfer, the transferee or transferor may request a statement of the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: The company must, within 28 days after receiving a request under subrule (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send the person who made the request a statement of the reasons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register the transfer.

subsection.content: This rule does not apply if the open-ended fund company is entitled to refuse to register the transfer under rule 62(1) or (3).

If an open-ended fund company contravenes subrule (2) or (4), the company commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Refusal to register transfer of shares

subsection.leadIn: An open-ended fund company may, within 2 months after the instrument of transfer is lodged, refuse to register the transfer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there exists a minimum requirement as to the number or value of shares that are to be held by a shareholder of the open-ended fund company, and the transfer would result in either the transferor or the transferee holding less than the required minimum; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transfer would result in a contravention of a provision of the open-ended fund company’s instrument of incorporation, or would produce a result inconsistent with any provision of the company’s offering documents.
